result.execSummary:
The defendant Jon S. Thome Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Huber granted.  *Report clean & sober.  *May serve in Winnebago County.
*Bond on file to be applied to restitution and costs and balance returned to the poster.  *Restitution to be paid out to victim by Clerk of Courts Office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jon S. Thome Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Jon S. Thome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Theft, 943.20(1) and states alford plea agreement to that amended charge.
Atty Hendee files a victim impact statement with the court.
Atty Gumz agrees.  
BY THE COURT:  Ct 1 will be amended to Misd. Theft, 943.20(1).

Defendant enters a No Contest Alford plea.    Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1 Misd. Theft, 943.20(1).

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with the defendant's Agent, he will not be revoking him and states jail credit.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before October 3, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Credit = 26 days
May serve in Winnebego County
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $1,225.00 + $122.50 surcharge = $1,347.00 (bond to cover is to be paid out to the victim by the COC office)
Bond to be applied; balance be paid to the party that posted it.
Plea hearing on August 3, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Final pre-trial on May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jon S. Thome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the State is ready to proceed.  Atty Gumz is prepared to proceed today.  
Detective Sergeant Aaron Williams called and sworn; examined by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Gumz.
Witness excused.

Atty Hendee asks the court to find probable cause.
Atty Gumz makes arguments.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant received a copy of the information and waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Trial.
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jon S. Thome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz requests this matter be set for preliminary hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Set for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jon S. Thome in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim and asks for a Return.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BAIL

Defendant Jon S. Thome by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests cash bond.  Atty Gumz requests signature bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
